evaluation_prompt:
You are an expert evaluator assessing an AI agent’s work product for a Concierge / Senior Lifestyle Manager task in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing. You will be given: (1) the original task prompt, (2) any referenced input/source files or links mentioned by the prompt, and (3) the agent’s OUTPUT FILES/ARTIFACTS. Your job is to inspect the output artifacts (not just the narrative) and score quality on a 0–10 scale using the rubric below.

CRITICAL RULE (NON-NEGOTIABLE): If ANY required output file/artifact is missing, not accessible, wrong file type (when specified), or the work is severely incomplete (e.g., missing required sections/tables/itinerary/pages), you MUST assign an overall score in the 0–2 range, regardless of how good the available content is.

Evaluation procedure:
1) Parse the prompt and extract a checklist of explicit deliverables and constraints. Examples of common Concierge deliverables in this category: a Word document with titled tables; a styled PDF itinerary with specific headers; a multi-day travel/yacht plan; inclusion of images; links; directions from a specified origin; constraints like page length (e.g., two pages), duration (e.g., 4 hours), audience (UHNW clients), and required sections (e.g., Overview of Activities, Highlights, Inclusions, Requirements).
2) Inventory output artifacts: confirm each required file exists, opens, and matches required format (DOCX/PDF, named file, correct page count if specified). Record any missing/incorrect artifacts.
3) Inspect contents against requirements:
   - Structure: required title/headline, intro, section headers, tables with required column names, itinerary steps, inclusions/requirements lists, etc.
   - Data fidelity: factual accuracy (hours, addresses, operator/site details), internal consistency (times add up to stated duration), correct directions/origin, correct categories/tags, and that excluded items truly are excluded.
   - Sources/compliance: where prompt requires sourcing (e.g., a specific website list + Google Maps details), verify that the content plausibly matches the sources and that citations/links are provided as required. When the prompt requires royalty-free images, confirm an explicit royalty-free source/URL is provided and the image appears embedded.
   - Professionalism: layout, readability, client-facing tone, correct spelling/grammar, and concierge best practices (clear meeting points, contingency notes, restrictions, accessibility, and practical tips).
4) Score each rubric dimension (0–10), then compute weighted score (Completeness 40%, Correctness 30%, Quality 20%, Domain Standards 10%).
5) Apply the CRITICAL override: if any required artifact is missing/incomplete, set final overall score to 0–2.

Output of your evaluation should include: (a) overall score 0–10, (b) brief justification per rubric dimension, (c) explicit callout of any missing artifacts/requirements, (d) the top fixes needed to reach 9–10.

completeness.description: All required output files exist and all task requirements are addressed.
criteria: All required files are present, accessible, and in the specified format (e.g., PDF vs DOCX), including any naming requirements if explicitly stated.
Document length constraints are met when specified (e.g., two pages; 4-hour plan; seven-day itinerary).
All required sections are present with the exact or clearly equivalent headers when requested (e.g., Overview of Activities, Inclusions, Requirements).
All required tables are present with required titles/subtitles and exact column names when specified (e.g., Restaurant Name, Business Hours, Description, Directions, Category).
All required fields are populated in each row/item (no placeholder text; no empty cells; no 'TBD' unless allowed).
All required links are included and functional where required (e.g., restaurant website hyperlinks titled with the restaurant name).
All required media is included (e.g., a small photo) and appears embedded in the output file; required source attribution/URL is present where requested.
All prompt constraints are explicitly addressed (e.g., exclude permanently closed venues; start location for directions; max group size; meeting location and end point).
completeness.scoring_guidance: 0-2 if any required file is missing/inaccessible/wrong type OR the work is severely incomplete (missing major sections/tables/itinerary steps/page requirement); 3-4 if multiple major requirements are unmet (e.g., missing required sections, many rows missing data); 5-6 if core deliverable exists but several notable omissions (e.g., missing some required fields, partial sourcing, incomplete directions); 7-8 if nearly everything is present with only minor omissions (e.g., small missing details, minor header mismatch); 9-10 if fully complete with all requirements satisfied and no substantive omissions.

correctness.description: Accuracy of data, calculations, information, and logic.
criteria: Factual accuracy of key details required by the prompt (addresses, meeting points, business hours, operator/site descriptions, age requirements, restrictions).
Internal consistency: timelines add up (e.g., a 4-hour tour itinerary sums to ~4 hours including buffer); day-by-day plan totals match stated trip length; start/end locations align with directions.
Directions quality: directions are plausible from the specified origin and do not contradict geography (e.g., correct neighborhood/city, realistic transit modes when implied).
Correct categorization/tagging when required (e.g., dining category assignments are consistent with definitions; avoids mislabeling).
Correct application of exclusions/filters (e.g., permanently closed venues excluded; non-included options listed as 'not included').
Links and references are appropriate and point to the intended entities (not wrong restaurant, wrong tour operator, or generic search pages when specific website requested).
Royalty-free image compliance correctness when required: source is a legitimate royalty-free provider and is cited; image is relevant to the location/site.
correctness.scoring_guidance: 0-2 if pervasive inaccuracies, fabricated specifics presented as facts, or contradictions that make the deliverable unreliable; 3-4 if many key facts are wrong/unsupported (e.g., wrong meeting location, incorrect duration math, multiple incorrect hours); 5-6 if generally correct but with notable errors or questionable claims; 7-8 if mostly accurate with only minor factual slips or minor inconsistencies; 9-10 if highly accurate, internally consistent, and carefully constrained to verifiable details.

criteria: Client-ready presentation: clean layout, consistent typography, clear hierarchy (title, headings, subheadings), and easy-to-scan structure.
Tables are readable: consistent column widths, wrapped text where needed, and no clutter; itinerary is formatted with times/steps clearly delineated.
Writing quality: concise, polished, concierge-appropriate tone; minimal grammar/spelling errors; avoids repetitive filler.
Visual organization elements included when requested (e.g., icons for location/time/overview) and they enhance comprehension rather than distract.
PDF/DOCX technical quality: correct pagination, no broken images, no truncated text, working hyperlinks, and no obvious conversion artifacts.
quality.scoring_guidance: 0-2 if unreadable, disorganized, or severely unprofessional; 3-4 if poorly formatted with frequent writing errors and hard-to-follow structure; 5-6 if adequate but noticeably rough (inconsistent formatting, wordy, minor layout issues); 7-8 if polished with only small presentation issues; 9-10 if exceptionally professional, visually coherent, and highly usable by concierge staff or clients.

domain_standards.description: Industry-specific best practices for concierge and luxury lifestyle management.
criteria: Practical concierge details included where relevant: meeting location clarity, arrival recommendations, buffer times, accessibility notes, dress code/what to bring, and contingency options (weather, delays).
Guest-centric personalization consistent with prompt (ages, first-time visitors, time limits, interests, luxury expectations).
Safety and compliance awareness: clearly states restrictions (e.g., security, permitted containers), difficulty level, age limits, and what is/not included; avoids unsafe suggestions.

Appropriate luxury positioning: VIP framing without making unverifiable promises; clear articulation of premium elements (licensed guide, small group, early access) only if supported by prompt/source.
Actionability for staff use: information is operational (addresses, directions, contact/links when required, clear next steps).
domain_standards.scoring_guidance: 0-2 if ignores concierge context and omits basic operational needs; 3-4 if limited practicality and weak alignment to client profile; 5-6 if some concierge best practices present but uneven; 7-8 if strong, guest-ready and operational; 9-10 if exemplary luxury concierge standard with thoughtful, practical refinements and high trustworthiness.

file_inspection_checklist: Confirm each required output file exists (by name if specified) and is accessible/openable (no corruption, no permission errors).
Verify file type matches prompt (PDF vs DOCX); if the prompt requires PDF styling/icons/images, ensure it is an actual PDF with embedded visuals, not plain text.
Check length constraints: page count (e.g., two pages), trip duration (e.g., seven days), activity duration (e.g., 4 hours).
Scan for required title/headline and introduction/overview sections; confirm required section headers are present and correctly labeled when explicitly required.
If tables are required: confirm table titles/subtitles; confirm column headers exactly match required names; confirm rows are populated (no empty required fields).
If links are required: click/validate that hyperlinks exist, are correctly titled (e.g., restaurant name), and point to the correct target (official site when required).
If directions are required: verify origin matches prompt; directions are plausible and include clear steps/mode; ensure no contradictory addresses.

If sourcing is required (specific website lists, Google Maps details, operator descriptions): confirm references/URLs are present and content aligns with those sources; flag uncited or dubious claims.
If exclusions are required (e.g., permanently closed): check the output does not include excluded entities; look for evidence of status checking.

If inclusions/requirements are required: ensure both lists exist and include all specified items (languages, not-included items, restrictions, difficulty, age requirements) plus customary items when asked.
If images are required: confirm images are embedded and relevant; verify attribution/royalty-free source URL is provided and credible.
Check for professionalism: consistent formatting, spelling/grammar, readability, and whether the artifact is ready for client/staff use without additional editing.
common_failure_modes: Missing required output file(s) (e.g., no PDF/DOCX delivered) or wrong format delivered.
Document exists but is severely incomplete (missing tables, missing itinerary steps, missing required sections/headers, or largely placeholder content).
Ignores explicit constraints (wrong duration, wrong page count, wrong start location, missing meeting/end point).
Tables present but missing required columns or many blank cells; restaurant list not sourced from required page.
Includes permanently closed venues or fails to demonstrate exclusion logic.
Hyperlinks missing, not titled correctly, or point to wrong/irrelevant pages (e.g., Google search results instead of official sites).
Business hours, addresses, or operator/site details appear fabricated or inconsistent; internal contradictions in itinerary timing.
No image included when required, or image included without royalty-free sourcing/attribution.
Poorly formatted PDF (no icons when required, cluttered layout, broken images, unreadable text).
Overpromising VIP access or special privileges without support from prompt/source; lacks standard concierge disclaimers/notes.

scoring_guidelines.overall_approach: Compute weighted average: completeness (40%), correctness (30%), quality (20%), domain_standards (10%). CRITICAL OVERRIDE: If any required output file is missing/inaccessible/wrong required type OR deliverable is severely incomplete (missing major required sections/tables/itinerary/pages), set overall score to 0–2 regardless of weighted result.
automatic_low_score_triggers: Any required output file is missing, inaccessible, or not the specified file type (e.g., DOCX required but only text provided; PDF required but not delivered).

Work is severely incomplete: missing major required sections (e.g., no itinerary steps, no inclusions/requirements, no tables) or fails page/day/duration constraints in a way that indicates incomplete fulfillment.
Large portions of required fields are blank/placeholder (e.g., 'TBD', missing hours/directions/links across many entries).
Output cannot be used operationally (e.g., corrupted file, unreadable formatting, broken/absent key information like meeting location).
excellent_output_characteristics: All required artifacts present, correctly named (if required), correct format, and open cleanly.
All specified sections, tables, headers, and constraints satisfied; no missing required fields.
Accurate, internally consistent facts and timing; directions and logistics are clear and plausible.
Professional, client-ready design with clean layout; icons/images included when required with proper royalty-free attribution.
Concierge best practices included: practical tips, restrictions, contingency notes, and guest-centric tailoring without unverifiable claims.
poor_output_characteristics: Missing or wrong-format deliverables; incomplete documents lacking major components.
Multiple unmet requirements (missing headers, missing columns, missing inclusions/requirements).
Noticeable factual inaccuracies, contradictions, or likely fabricated details presented as facts.
Unprofessional formatting and unclear organization; broken links/images; no sourcing where required.
Not actionable for concierge operations (unclear meeting point, no directions, no constraints addressed).

example_evaluation_questions: Are all required output files present, openable, and in the correct format (PDF/DOCX) as specified in the prompt?
Does the document meet explicit structure requirements (title/headline, intro, required section headers, table titles/subtitles, required columns)?
Are all required fields populated (e.g., every restaurant row has hours, description, directions from the specified origin, category, and a correctly titled hyperlink)?
Where a duration is specified (e.g., 4 hours), does the step-by-step itinerary realistically fit within it including transitions/buffer time?
Are logistics correct and operationally useful (meeting location, end point, addresses, navigation steps, transit mode clarity)?
Are facts likely accurate and consistent with required sources (specified website lists, Google Maps details, operator/site info)? Are citations/URLs provided when required?
Were exclusions applied correctly (e.g., permanently closed venues not included; 'not included' items explicitly listed)?
If images are required, are they embedded and credited with a legitimate royalty-free source URL?
Is the output concierge- and luxury-client ready (polished tone, clear formatting, actionable recommendations, appropriate caveats/restrictions)?
What are the top 3 issues that prevent a 9–10 score, and what exact changes would fix them?

metadata.sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing
